alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 24 at 9:26AM HST until January 25 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI LANAI AND FOR LOWER ELEVATIONS ON MAUI... ...HIGH WIND WARNING FOR MAUNA KEA AND MAUNA LOA SUMMITS STARTING THIS AFTERNOON... .Strong and gusty southwest winds are expected through this afternoon in the lower elevations of the smaller islands as a cold front moves down the island chain. Winds will be strongest in and near heavy showers, and where terrain most accelerates the flow over the north and east side of the islands, and over portions of central Oahu. Over the Big Island Summits, west winds gradually increasing through the day, becoming dangerously strong tonight. ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...West winds strengthening to 40 to 60 mph tonight, with gusts near 80 mph expected. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 6 PM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can make driving and walking dangerous. The winds can forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: Be prepared for road-closures. Postpone travel to the summits until conditions improve.
